result.execSummary:
The defendant William Henry Kolsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution payable to Michelle Elliott for $588.28 or civil judgment with tax intercept. Cash bail applied.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable costs and surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered. Cash bail applied.

Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court also advised the defendant that because he was convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm within 5 years of completing sentence or he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement.

Pursuant to 973.08, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the Sex Offender Registry with DOC.

- NO CONTACT with the victim(s) or the victim's family, including through social media.
- No illegal internet activity.

- Sex Offender Assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
- Cognitive Intervention Programming.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Henry Kolsch

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Anthony D Cotton in court with William Henry Kolsch.  Attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Michelle E.

The Court WITHHELD sentence and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* No contact with the victim(s) or the victim's family, including through social media.
* No illegal internet activity.
* Obtain and maintain employment .
* Restitution payable to Michelle Elliott for $588.28 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  The Court also advised the defendant that because he was convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm within 5 years of completing sentence or he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.

Attorney Anthony D Cotton in court for William Henry Kolsch.  Attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State has complied with victim notification.

Amended information received and filed.  Defense counsel waived reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

No PSI is ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing.

Court orders the defendant REMANDED til sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 15, Judge J.D. Watts. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Defendant William Henry Kolsch in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant William Henry Kolsch in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
